column3: Can someone on MacOSX please test this?\n

I can't test USE_SSL right now. For everything else, I've found no problems. All those commits are part of my [current release](https://github.com/p2k/bitcoin-qt/downloads) and were pulled into my fork.\n
Thanks for testing @p2k and @luke-jr, as this is only UI changes I think that's enough. I'm merging this.\n
I thought we were on feature-freeze for 0.5...?\n

Ok I didn't know, I'll revert it tomorrow afternoon as I don't have access
to a pc right now
Op 16 okt. 2011 20:41 schreef "Matt Corallo" <
reply@reply.github.com>
het volgende:

> I thought we were on feature-freeze for 0.5...?
> 
> ## 
> 
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub:
> https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/583#issuecomment-2422284
Except for the shortcut keys, the rest of this is bugfixes. I don't see how the shortcut keys could be a problem, realistically.\n

Its not worth reverting, I just wondered why it got merged.

After sending coins - I get this alert dialog: http://cl.ly/2c0O0m0m3A090V2J2Y0R

And the client crashes about 10 seconds after that.  Related?

This is 0.5.2 version of Bitcoin-QT.  Max OSX Lion.  I have Growl 1.3.2 installed.
opened a issue here for further discussion: https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/issues/877\n
